entry.title: American Football House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that none of the members of American Football ever actually lived in the American Football House (pictured)?

entry.title: Alberto Caeiro (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the poet Fernando Pessoa considered Alberto Caeiro, one of his own heteronyms, to be his master?

entry.title: Shanghai Trolleybus Route 20 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shanghai Trolleybus Route 20 was so popular in the 1980s that it required 65 buses to run as little as 30 seconds apart?

entry.title: Robert Steuckers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Belgian far-right activist Robert Steuckers is critical of the French New Right for their lack of proficiency in German?

entry.title: 16th Avenue Tiled Steps (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to Fodor's Travel, the 16th Avenue Tiled Steps is "possibly the world's largest mosaic staircase"?

entry.title: Ida Mett (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ida Mett was expelled from a Russian anarchist group for mourning her deceased father by lighting a Yahrzeit candle?

entry.title: Beachin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Piri & Tommy's "Beachin" was an attempt at imitating the Isley Brothers?

entry.title: Newton's apple tree (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Newton's apple tree was blown down in a storm in 1816?
